preqs: One of FIT1005, FIT2008, FIT2020, BUS2062, CPE1007, CSE2004, CSE2318, CSE3318 or GCO3812

rules.ruleString: Incompatible with achievement in (I/W) {CPE3004, CSE3821, CSE5807, FIT3024, FIT3030}
Must have passed 1 (I/W) units in {BUS2062, CPE1007, CSE2004, CSE2318, CSE3318, FIT1005, FIT2008, FIT2020, GCO3812} with grades other than {STANDARD-DEF, STANDARD-NS}

description: This unit aims to introduce the systematic top-down network design approach for designing enterprise computer networks. A top down process focuses on requirements analysis and architecture design, which should be completed before the selection of specific network components. The unit provides students with tested processes and tools to help them understand traffic flow, communication protocol behaviour, and internetworking technologies. On completion of the unit, students are equipped to design enterprise computer networks that meet an enterprise users requirements for functionality, capacity, performance, availability, scalability, affordability, security, and manageability.
